1.text: As He was leaving the Temple, one of His disciples exclaimed, “Look, Rabbi, what wonderful stones! what wonderful buildings!”

2.text: “You see all these great buildings?” Jesus replied; “not one stone will be left here upon another—not thrown down.”

3.text: He was sitting on the Mount of Olives opposite to the Temple, when Peter, James, John, and Andrew, apart from the others asked Him,

4.text: “Tell us, When will these things be? and what will be the sign when all these predictions are on the point of being fulfilled?”

5.text: So Jesus began to say to them: “Take care that no one misleads you.

6.text: Many will come assuming my name and saying, ‘I am He;’ and they will mislead many.

7.text: But when you hear of wars and rumours of wars, do not be alarmed: come they must, but the End is not yet.

8.text: For nation will rise in arms against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. There will be earthquakes in various places; there will be famines. These miseries are but like the early pains of childbirth.

9.text: “You yourselves must be on your guard. They will deliver you up to Sanhedrins; you will be brought into synagogues and cruelly beaten; and you will stand before governors and kings for my sake, to be witnesses to them for me.

10.text: But the proclamation of the Good News must be carried to all the Gentiles before the End comes.

11.text: When however they are marching you along under arrest, do not be anxious beforehand about what you are to say, but speak what is given you when the time comes; for it will not be you who speak, but the Holy Spirit.

12.text: “Brother will betray brother to be killed, and fathers will betray children; and children will rise against their parents and have them put to death.

13.text: You will be objects of universal hatred because you are called by my name, but those who stand firm to the End will be saved.

14.text: “As soon, however, as you see the Abomination of Desolation standing where he ought not”—let the reader observe these words—”then let those in Judaea escape to the hills;

15.text: let him who is on the roof not come down and enter the house to fetch anything out of it;

16.text: and let not him who is in the field turn back to pick up his outer garment.

17.text: And alas for the women who at that time are with child or have infants!

18.text: “But pray that it may not come in the winter.

19.text: For those will be times of suffering the like of which has never been from the first creation of God’s world until now, and assuredly never will be again;

20.text: and but for the fact that the Lord has cut short those days, no one would escape; but for the sake of His own People whom He has chosen for Himself He has cut short the days.

21.text: “At that time if any one says to you, ‘See, here is the Christ!’ or ‘See, He is there!’ do not believe it.

22.text: For there will rise up false Christs and false prophets, displaying signs and prodigies with a view to lead astray—if indeed that were possible—even God’s own People.

23.text: But as for yourselves, be on your guard: I have forewarned you of everything.

24.text: “At that time, however, after that distress, the sun will be darkened and the moon will not shed her light;

25.text: the stars will be seen falling from the firmament, and the forces which are in the heavens will be disordered and disturbed.

26.text: And then will they see the Son of Man coming in clouds with great power and glory.

27.text: Then He will send forth the angels and gather together His chosen People from north, south, east and west, from the remotest parts of the earth and the sky.

28.text: “Learn from the fig-tree the lesson it teaches. As soon as its branch has become soft and it is bursting into leaf, you know that summer is near.

29.text: So also do you, when you see these things happening, be sure that He is near, at your very door.

30.text: I tell you in solemn truth that the present generation will certainly not pass away without all these things having first taken place.

31.text: Earth and sky will pass away, but it is certain that my words will not pass away.

32.text: “But as to that day or the exact time no one knows—not even the angels in Heaven, nor the Son, but the Father alone.

33.text: Take care, be on the alert, and pray; for you do not know when it will happen.

34.text: It is like a man living abroad who has left his house, and given the management to his servants—to each one his special duty—and has ordered the porter to keep awake.

35.text: Be wakeful therefore, for you know not when the master of the house is coming—in the evening, at midnight, at cock-crow, or at dawn.

36.text: Beware lest He should arrive unexpectedly and find you asleep.

37.text: Moreover, what I say to you I say to all—Be wakeful!”
